Low pressure Cherenkov : 1.2 bar; High pressure Cherenkov : 14 bar; Previously, the LP Cherenkov had been at 0.2 bar. Now rejection of about 1/3 of beam triggers in the spill due to seeing light in the LP Cherenkov (before, it seemed more like 5%). Fraction of events with light in the high pressure but not low pressure, though I think at 1 GeV beam we should be below the cherenkov threshold for muons and pions still, so that may help be a measure of the inefficiency in the trigger.
Daphne timing errors since 15-07-2024 22:53
DAPHNE board 107 dead. Reset clock APA4 at 17:17 [Manuel]

Manuel swapped out the DAPHNE controller 7 board with controller 10 (APA1 streaming readout), and moved the firmware back to the simpler threshold algorithm. This change is valid as of run 28035.Unfortunately, as the IP address of the controller board needs to match the slot number as of now, we had to change the mapping in the DAPHNE readout, so now what was in 'slot 7' is now slot 10. This will impact that offline channel mapping (and perhaps also the DQM?).

5GeV Beam and using CRT Triggers

We are running with +5 GeV beam and triggering on signals where we see light in the HP cherenkov and no light in the LP one. This should be a trigger for kaons, but we think the rate is a bit high, as it's ~25 Hz out of a total ~250 Hz beam trigger. Event displays don't look obviously bad though. CTB experts are cross-checking the trigger configurations and trigger words. We can run stably like this for now and do further investigations in the morning.

Run with CTB at 5 GeV beam, HLx trigger. Reshape 10 ticks, LLT1 delay of 5 ticks, LLT3 (LP cherenkov) delay of 1 tick, with CRT now, fixing reshaping error, truly this time. no, seriously, really, it is going to be good this time.

Huge thanks to James, Jon, and Ben, but we have a fix on the configuration of the CTB so the reshaping time is being applied to beam LLTs. We've updated the Cherenkov configurations such that the LP Cherenkov signal is delayed by 1 time tick (16 ns) relative to the HP, and the beam signal is delayed by 5 time ticks (80 ns) relative to the HP, which we determined empirically works.

We think we have a good working configuration for the kaon triggering. I'm starting up a run with the CRT now that should then be good to run for the night, and hopefully the weekend.A few notes, and please help pass these along to the next shifters:

    * the rate during the beam spill should be relatively low: ~5-10 Hz at most. Don't be surprised by that, but do keep an eye on it.
    * There are a number of warnings that come from the ctbhsi about some missing of matching words. they will look like CTB Word Matching Issue: No match found for HLT: TS = 107740099525322175, trigger word = 0x200 Adjacent input ts: 107740099525322128 107740099525323186. These are ok. You may want to filter these warning messages from the grafana (if you scroll to the right, you can select everything but ctbmodules::CTBWordMatchWarning in the issue name, clicking on the filter button). Please try to look out for other kinds of warnings and errors.
    * There is no prescale applied for these configurations, and both configs with and without CRT should be ok to use.
    * If for some reason someone mentions to you that they are regenerating configurations, you may help remind them that this will override the CTB config, and they should be careful. Contact a DAQ expert if there's any confusion. (DAQ experts should know what to do)

running ColdADC tests, 1800mV, -5 GeV beam, collimators will be set to be low to accommodate trigger rate, all cherenkov combinations collected in trigger (so, all beam triggered, but labeled with cherenkov states)                                                                

We moved beam to -5 GeV, collimators at +-5 mm. Configurations have been updated to include all cherenkov combinations (so triggering on all beam)
    * We started a run with np04_TPC_PDS_TPGLowThr_ctbBeamCherenkov_ColdADC1800mV_ssh.json configuration around 10:00. We will plan to let this run until 12:00.
    * Assuming we've had reasonably stable beam, at 12:00 we will switch to np04_TPC_PDS_TPGLowThr_ctbBeamCherenkov_ssh.json and run with that until 14:00.
    * Assuming we've had reasonable stable beam in that period, at 14:00 we will switch to np04_TPC_PDS_TPGLowThr_ctbBeamCherenkov_ColdADC1780mV_ssh.json , and run with that until 17:00.
    * At around 17:00, we will bring the beam back to the -1 GeV configuration, recreate configurations to trigger on HxLx and HLx only, and setup a normal run for the evening.

We've finished our ColdADC runs today, and moved back to -1 GeV beam with collimators at +/-40mm. There's no beam in machine however, and not likely for another hour, so fingers crossed we are actually setup for beam.
